text: Union County Courthouse is a historic courthouse located at Liberty, Union County, Indiana. It was designed by noted Indianapolis architect George W. Bunting and built in 1890–1891. It is a two-story, rectangular, Richardsonian Romanesque style rock faced ashlar stone building on a raised basement. It has a hipped roof and features an arched entrance and four-story clock tower. Note: This includes and Accompanying photographs It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1987. It is located in the Liberty Courthouse Square Historic District. ==References== Category:County courthouses in Indiana Category:Clock towers in Indiana Category:Courthouses on the National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Richardsonian Romanesque architecture in Indiana Category:Government buildings completed in 1891 Category:Buildings and structures in Union County, Indiana Category:National Register of Historic Places in Union County, Indiana Category:Historic district contributing properties in Indiana
title: Union County Courthouse (Indiana)
